name: Slivka, Admrx., et al. v. Ference et al., Appellants

judges: Before Maxey, C. J., Drew, Linn, Stern, Patterson, Stearne and Jones, JJ.
parties: Slivka, Admrx., et al. v. Ference et al., Appellants.

opinions.text:
Per Curiam,
The judgment is affirmed on the opinion of Judge Smart of the court below.
opinions.author: Per Curiam,

attorneys: William, A. Ghallener, Jr., with him William A. Ghallener, Harold F. Reed and Ghallener & Ghallener, for appellants, Jones & Laughlin Steel Corp. and Wood-lawn Land Company.

Dickie, Robinson & McCamey, for Ohio River Motor Coach.
casebody.head_matter:
Slivka, Admrx., et al. v. Ference et al., Appellants.
Argued November 29, 1945.
Before Maxey, C. J., Drew, Linn, Stern, Patterson, Stearne and Jones, JJ.
William, A. Ghallener, Jr., with him William A. Ghallener, Harold F. Reed and Ghallener & Ghallener, for appellants, Jones & Laughlin Steel Corp. and Wood-lawn Land Company.
Ralph H. Demmler, with him J ohn J. Heard, J ohn B. Gordon and Reed, Smith, Shaw & McGlay, for appellee, Pittsburgh & Lake Erie Railroad Co.
Thompson Bradshaw, for plaintiff.
Margiotti £ Gasey, for J. C. Slivka.
Dickie, Robinson & McCamey, for Ohio River Motor Coach.
January 7, 1946:
